meanings.definition: A person who makes mistakes or is clumsy in their work.
meanings.sent1: The bunglers at the construction site kept dropping their tools.
meanings.sent2: The team of bunglers struggled to follow the instructions correctly.
meanings.sent3: The bunglers in the kitchen accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: The group of bunglers were like bulls in a china shop, causing chaos wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bunglers tripping over each other will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To carry out a task clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: She bunglers her attempt to fix the leaky faucet by making it worse.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic bunglers the repair job, leaving the car in worse condition.
meanings.sent3: He bunglers his way through the dance routine, stepping on toes along the way.
meanings.sent4: The magician bunglers his disappearing act, revealing the trick too soon.
meanings.sent5: The chef bunglers the recipe, resulting in a burnt and inedible dish.
